com.mousebird.maply

Class QuadPagingLayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mousebird.maply.Layer
      • com.mousebird.maply.QuadPagingLayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LayerThread.ViewWatcherInterface

    public class QuadPagingLayer
extends Layer
implements LayerThread.ViewWatcherInterface
    The quad paging layer is a general purpose data paging layer. You hand it an object that implements the PagingInterface and it will do the rest.

    It's up to you to create geometry when called upon, but this layer will handle the deletion and turning it on and off as needed when the user moves around.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  QuadPagingLayer.PagingInterface
      This is the interface paging delegates must fill in.

    • Constructor Detail

      • QuadPagingLayer

        public QuadPagingLayer(MaplyBaseController inMaplyControl,
                       CoordSystem inCoordSys,
                       QuadPagingLayer.PagingInterface inDelegate)
        Construct with the information needed to page geometry into the system.
        Parameters:
        inMaplyControl - The Maply Controller we'll be using.
        inCoordSys - The coordinate system the pager is in, though not necessarily the geometry. In most cases this will be SphericalMercatorCoordSystem.
        inDelegate - The paging object itself. This is what you need to implement.

      • setSingleLevelLoading

        public void setSingleLevelLoading(boolean newVal)
        If set we'll skip the lower levels of the pyramid and load only the current target zoom level.

      • getMinTime

        public float getMinTime()
        Description copied from interface: LayerThread.ViewWatcherInterface
        This minimum time before unique viewUpdated() calls. Layers can't handle rapid changes of the view, typically. So we pick a period, such as 1/10s that we can handle and specify that here. The viewUpdated() calls will come no more often than this.
        Specified by:
        getMinTime in interface LayerThread.ViewWatcherInterface

      • getMaxLagTime

        public float getMaxLagTime()
        Description copied from interface: LayerThread.ViewWatcherInterface
        How long the layer can go without a viewUpdated() call.
        Specified by:
        getMaxLagTime in interface LayerThread.ViewWatcherInterface

      • startLayer

        public void startLayer(LayerThread layerThread)
        Description copied from class: Layer
        Once your layer is created and handed to the LayerThread, it needs to actually be started on that layer. This call indicates the layer has been started on the thread and can hook itself into the system, generating geometry or registering for view changes and such.
        Overrides:
        startLayer in class Layer

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Description copied from class: Layer
        This method is called when a layer is to be removed. The layer should clean up any objects it may have created.

        If the MaplyController is shut down, you may not get this call and instead may simply be deleted.

        Overrides:
        shutdown in class Layer

      • viewUpdated

        public void viewUpdated(ViewState viewState)
        Description copied from interface: LayerThread.ViewWatcherInterface
        This method is called when the view updates, but no more often then the minTime().
        Specified by:
        viewUpdated in interface LayerThread.ViewWatcherInterface
        Parameters:
        viewState - The new state for the view associated with the MaplyController.

      • refresh

        public void refresh()
        If you call this, the layer will clear out all current geometry and refetch everything.

      • addData

        public void addData(ComponentObject compObj,
                    MaplyTileID tileID)
        When the paging object has loaded a component object, it tells us about it here.
        Parameters:
        compObj - The component object handed back by the Maply Controller.
        tileID - The tile we've loaded data for.

      • addData

        public void addData(java.util.List<ComponentObject> compObjs,
                    MaplyTileID tileID)
        When the paging object has loaded several component objects, it tells us about them here.
        Parameters:
        compObjs - The component objects handed back by the Maply Controller.
        tileID - The tile we've loaded data for.

      • tileDidLoad

        public void tileDidLoad(MaplyTileID tileID)
        The paging object calls this once it has created all the visual data associated with the tile. The paging layer will then do some calculation and figure out what parents and children to turn on and off to accommodate the new tile.

        Call this on any thread.

        Parameters:
        tileID - The tile that successfully loaded.

      • tileFailedToLoad

        public void tileFailedToLoad(MaplyTileID tileID)
        When a tile fails to load successfully, the paging object calls this method to let the paging layer know.

        Call this on any thread.

        Parameters:
        tileID - The tile that did not load successfully.

      • setEnable

        public void setEnable(boolean newEnable)
        Turn any created geometry on and off as a group.

      • setSimultaneousFetches

        public void setSimultaneousFetches(int numFetches)
        We can only have a certain number of fetches going at once. We'll create this number of threads (in some cases) based on this number.

      • setUseTargetZoomLevel

        public void setUseTargetZoomLevel(boolean newVal)
        If set we'll calculate a single target zoom level for the whole viewport, rather than evaluating tiles individually. This works for 2D maps, but not for 3D maps or globes.

      • nativeSetSingleLevelLoading

        public void nativeSetSingleLevelLoading(boolean newVal)

      • setMaxTiles

        public void setMaxTiles(int numTiles)
        Set the maximum number of tiles we'll try to load at once.

      • setTileHeightRange

        public void setTileHeightRange(double minZ,
                               double maxZ)
        Set the height range for tiles that may be loaded. This is for the whole database. There's another way to specify it per tile.

      • setUseParentTileBounds

        public void setUseParentTileBounds(boolean parentBounds)
        If set we'll use the parent tile bounds for loading. This is useful when tiles are not additive. That is, if higher res geometyr replaces lower res.

      • setImportance

        public void setImportance(double imp)
        This is the number of pixels we'll want a tile to be before we load it.
